auto_merge.commit_message:
The cursor movement autocommand can not detect when the final tabstop $0
is directly adjacent to another tabstop, which prevents ending the
snippet session. The fix is an early return when jumping.
auto_merge.commit_title: fix(snippet): early return for final tabstop #35115

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
The [cursor movement autocommand](https://github.com/TheBlob42/neovim/blob/e66e62e0a321e0b4b1ebe892e7534f8e451a5402/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua#L358-L370) can not detect when the final tabstop `$0` is directly adjacent to another tabstop, which prevents ending the snippet session. The fix is an early return when jumping.

### Example

- execute `:lua vim.snippet.expand('local ${1:local} = ${2:value}')`
> The example does not specify the `$0` tabstop explicitly but instead relies on the automatically inserted one at the end of the snippet text
- cursor is at the first tabstop
- press `<Tab>` to jump to the second tabstop
- press `<Tab>` to jump to the final tabstop `$0` (this should end the snippet)
- press `<Tab>` with the intention to insert a tab character, instead it cycles back to the first tabstop
- this cycle can not be broken 🌀 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d2dbbefb-03f7-419d-8c3b-6078eef3d4d9

Note: We probably could also adjust the cursor movement autocommand in some way to achieve the same result, but I personally prefer the early return as it is very clear. However I am open for any feedback in case another approach is preferred.

comment_data.body: Do you know why https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua#L372-L374 isn't handling this case?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -585,6 +585,12 @@ function M.jump(direction)
   M._session.current_tabstop = dest
   select_tabstop(dest)
 
+  -- Early return for final tabstop.

comment_data.body:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua#L358-L370

Due to above `tabstop_index ~= 0` being true, it never reaches https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua#L372-L374
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -585,6 +585,12 @@ function M.jump(direction)
   M._session.current_tabstop = dest
   select_tabstop(dest)
 
+  -- Early return for final tabstop.

comment_data.body: Hmmm the change in this test makes me realize that this PR stops the snippet session _before_ going to the final tabstop, but I think we should still allow the cursor to go the final tabstop and end the session at that point.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1309,7 +1309,7 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: integration', function()
     end)
     feed('<C-n><C-y>')
     eq(
-      { true, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },
+      { false, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },

comment_data.body: Exactly ☝️ this is however a special case: The if statement there is true for both `$2` and `$0` since both are directly adjacent to one another in the snippet, so they will always "share" parts of their range. Maybe we can change this code to address this, but currently we do not know the "destination" and we don't want to stop the session yet when user just jumped to `$2`. This is why used an early return in the `jump` function (where we know the destination) instead.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -585,6 +585,12 @@ function M.jump(direction)
   M._session.current_tabstop = dest
   select_tabstop(dest)
 
+  -- Early return for final tabstop.

comment_data.body: Is it? We call `select_tabstop(dest)` **before** checking for the early return and ending the session. Also in my understanding the session should end as soon as we reach the final tabstop, currently it is ending when we are at the final tabstop and the cursor moves (which triggers the autocommand)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1309,7 +1309,7 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: integration', function()
     end)
     feed('<C-n><C-y>')
     eq(
-      { true, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },
+      { false, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },

comment_data.body: If I'm reading this test correctly, the cursor is not at the final tabstop (`$0`) at this point, and hence `vim.snippet.active({ direction = 1 })` should still return true.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1309,7 +1309,7 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: integration', function()
     end)
     feed('<C-n><C-y>')
     eq(
-      { true, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },
+      { false, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },

comment_data.body: Since the [snippet](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843/test/functional/plugin/lsp/completion_spec.lua#L1291) `then\n\t$0\nend` only has a single tabstop which is $0 we should be at the final tabstop immediately after expanding it when it is selected [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843/test/functional/plugin/lsp/completion_spec.lua#L1310) (if I am not reading it wrong).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1309,7 +1309,7 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: integration', function()
     end)
     feed('<C-n><C-y>')
     eq(
-      { true, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },
+      { false, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },

comment_data.body: Gotcha, I just realized that the `if else` is inserted before expanding the snippet and isn't part of a modification done in a snippet's tabstop.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1309,7 +1309,7 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: integration', function()
     end)
     feed('<C-n><C-y>')
     eq(
-      { true, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },
+      { false, { 'if true then', '\t', 'end' } },

comment_data.body: Could you please update [this comment](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua#L372) to something like "The cursor is not on a tabstop so exit the session" since we're handling reaching the end of the snippet here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -585,6 +585,12 @@ function M.jump(direction)
   M._session.current_tabstop = dest
   select_tabstop(dest)
 
+  -- Early return for final tabstop.

comment_regular_data.body:
Seems like the remaining tests are not caused by this PR, since these fails were already present on the last commit before. Can somebody deny or confirm this for me?

Regarding commit [eaf6eb4](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/35115/commits/eaf6eb480f9c8f40820619b84874c3cef4e80843) I chose the scope `tests` for the commit message, since this is an LSP test but the failure is related to snippet. Therefore I wasn't sure what to use. If you prefer a different scope for the message I will change it.
